content:
CONNECTDATA Struct

Definition

A Structure that contains data that is used internally by an application that has been upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

In this Article

[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
public struct CONNECTDATA
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
CONNECTDATA
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute ComVisibleAttribute

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Fields

cookie

An Integer used by the CONNECTDATAStructure.

public int cookie;
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute ComVisibleAttribute

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

pUnk

An IntPtr used by the CONNECTDATAStructure.

public IntPtr pUnk;
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute ComVisibleAttribute

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
